content: अणु {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (णु-ण्वी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [अण्-उन्] Minute, small, little, atomic (<ab>opp.</ab> स्थूल, महत्); अणोरणीयान् <ls>Bg. 8. 9</ls>; सर्वोप्ययं नन्वणुः <ls>Bh. 3. 26</ls> insignificantly small; अण्वपि भयं <ls>Ms. 6. 40</ls>; अण्वपि याच्यमानः <ls>Pt. 4. 26</ls> asked but an atom, a very small quantity, <ls>Ms. 3. 51.</ls> --णुः {@--1@} An atom, a very small particle (an exceedingly small measure); the mote in a sunbeam, the smallest perceptible quantity; अस्थूलमनण्वह्रस्वमदीर्घं ब्रह्म; अणुं पर्वतीकृ <ls>Bh. 2. 78</ls> to magnify; <ab>cf.</ab> also ‘To make mountains of molehills.’ {@--2@} An atom of time (व्यंजनमर्धमात्रा तदर्धं अणु); it is said to be 54,675,000th part of a Muhūrta (48 minutes). {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of very small grain such as सर्षप, चीनक &c., अनणुषु दशमांशोऽणुष्वथैकादशांशः <ls>Līlā.</ls> --णु {%<ab>n.</ab>%} the fourth part of a Mātrā.
